titleStmt.title: William A. Hooe et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6388

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Marion County Ky, most respectfully unite in the prayer of the Petition for the pardon of Solomon Corn, and ask you to pardon him out of the state penitentiary where he is now confined --

Wm A. Hooe
Harvy. J. Burns
James W Colwell
James D Hardin
John Elkins
E. J. Polk
R. F. Conner
Levi Divine
Richard Board clerk
Mercer Circuit Court
John G. Kyle
Isaac W. Terhune
J E Cogan
B F Patterson
A James
Thos E Miller
B L Hardin
S M Miller
J C Vanarsdall
John Schomp
Isaac Cole
John, Walden
Benjamin A. Low
Jas. W. Patterson
H. Smith
W. C. Gilder
Jas L McGohan
W pinkstun
W H. Donoho 3 Ky Reg
William Vanarsdall
Marcus B Curtis
A. D. Haynes
C. S. abell clerk co, Court
J. B. Jennings
W. Hulette
W. D. Burehell
John W Jenkins
W. H. Roach
Thos Edwards P J M C C
John Rupley
John C Donovan
Thomas W Jonson
John S Wadkins
William Maddox
Zackariah Hall
A J Heron
John C Jons
Nat Gaither

L C Galbert --

James Grider
